reviews.text:
Not only the food has no taste, the dumplings  were so awful , makes u feel like it was made yesterday for today.and it way over priced.
The money they are asking for is definitely not worth it.
I would rather  get a deli sandwich next time honestly.  Waste of money.  Seem like they do not know what salt is use for honestly ğŸ¤¦ğŸ»â€â™‚ï¸ if u have no taste buds and want eat uncooked half raw meat this is the place for u ğŸ‘ğŸ½
Canâ€™t lie this places was a easy 10/10 hands down that lamb was so fire sheesh ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥

Overall Score: 9.5/10

Food: 9.25/10
Service: 9.25/10
Atmosphere: 10/10

Authentic food, really delicious. We got various different foods, including the Peking Duck, green beans, and Grilled Pork.

Service was excellent; fast and delivered on time with great hospitality.

Environment was relaxing and I felt welcomed into the restaurant.

Overall, I totally recommend.
Amazing food and vibe! Had the peking duck, green beans, and fish soup and each dish was delicious. Will definitely be back again.

Love the food, excellent service and Peking
duck
Food is great. Very friendly service. Will come back again
Easy parking nearby at the mall. Great food and atmosphere. The staff is polite and knowledgeable. The restrooms are very clean.
Fantastic food. Itâ€™s like Iâ€™m in China. This is my go to place in flushing
Amazing experience. Servers were extremelt attentive and kind. We ordered the Peking Duck (half) and Soup Dumplings (Pork and Crab Meat). Both were delicious!
Food here is very delicious. The server was very considerate and kind. The wait time for food is also very quick and reasonable. Overall this place is perfect for locals and tourists.

We had such a wonderful experience here! Every dish was packed with flavor and made with so much care.

Big shoutout to Manager Hanson for being incredibly kind with attentive service,
we felt very well taken care of!

Now letâ€™s talk about the food:
The Four Treasures Soup was rich and comforting with tons of ingredients, the kind of soup that warms your whole body.

The salted egg yolk shrimp was amazing, and pairing it with the crispy fried dough is genius.
The frog with garlic was super fragrant and tender highly recommend.

The smoked pork neck was flavorful and had the perfect bite (my husband couldnâ€™t stop talking about this one ğŸ˜‚).

My personal favorite was the stir fried beef: spicy, fragrant, and very satisfying. Just a note: itâ€™s not super tender beef, so if you prefer melt in your mouth texture, keep that in mind.
We finished with the mango pomelo sago which was refreshing and delicious!

Also got a passion fruit mojito: fruity, strong, and really refreshing.

Definitely coming back. Highly recommend for anyone craving authentic and flavorful Jiangnan cuisine!
Beijing Duck is so good!!!
Friendly staff and delicious food. ğŸ‘
Eggplant is the best, eve

Fantastic
Great duck it was very tasty! Great service too
Great service and atmosphere, food good

Garlic pork belly had a simple, but tasty flavor. Pineapple beer is quite mild, tastes like juice. Soup dumplings are fantastic. Bacon rice is alright. Peking duck is pretty good. Overall a variety of options that you're sure to enjoy. Kind service and a pleasant atmosphere.
Great to come here with family! Love the sweet rice lotus dessert.
Love this food here! Perfect taste combination!
Love this place! Very good dishes meant to be shared family style
Love taking my family here! All their locations are great! Every
The food is splendid! Satisfies all my 5 senses! My personal favorite is the tomato fish!! A combination of sweet and sour!
Love the sweet sour fish here! Sweet lotus w sticky rice is great too â¤ï¸
Food is authentic! Yummy!

Food was good. It was fairly quiet and very clean.

We came here in October 2025 as a group of five to try Jiang Nan, and it was such a great experience! While waiting for our friends, the manager warmly invited us inside for tea, the service was truly excellent.

The meal started with a small appetizer, cabbage lightly pickled with chili oil, super appetizing! Ordering was easy with the tablet menu that has photos of each dish.

We tried the Dry Pot Cauliflower (spicy and flavorful), Braised Lionâ€™s Head Meatballs (rich and savory, perfect with rice), Kimchi Cheese Fried Rice (so good!), Garlic Pork Slices with Cucumber (refreshing and delicious), Sweet Sticky Rice Stuffed Lotus Root (great texture), and Crab Roe Tofu (silky and beautiful).

Every dish looked amazing and tasted even better. Such a wonderful meal, highly recommended!

Amazing food and great atmosphere!

I tried the Peking duck, sweet and sour bass, and minced bean sproutâ€”everything was delicious and beautifully presented.

The duck was crispy on the outside and tender inside, with the perfect balance of flavor. The sweet and sour bass was fresh and flavorful without being too heavy, and the minced bean sprout dish was a pleasant surpriseâ€”light, savory, and full of texture.

The service was attentive but not rushed, and the dining area felt upscale yet comfortable.

Definitely one of the best modern Chinese restaurants in Queens!

Highly recommend for anyone looking for authentic flavors with a refined touch.

One of my favorite Chinese places in the city. I've been to most of the Jiang Nan locations, and this is my favorite. The flavors are authentic, and the service is attentive. They have these small semi private tables in the back that are great for groups of 4. My favorite dishes are the eggplant with garlic sauce, cumin lamb, and peking duck. Definitely recommend!

The best restaurant in the flushing Chinatown area. The food tastes authentic, the service awesome and the price reasonable. The menu is varied and lots of options to choose from. Their soup dumplings are a hidden gem. The fried rice was also excellent..definite recommendation this place..will go back again and again
.

From the atmosphere to the Food, everything was simply perfectly to my liking. My boyfriend ordered the sea food fried rice and beef with potatoes and he absolutely loved it. I got the Peking duck. Which was phenomenal. We got two different soup dumplings chicken and pork which were mouth watering. Canâ€™t wait to visit here again!!!

This is one of my favorite Chinese restaurants, and today I had the chance to try their Flushing branch around 12:30 PM on a rainy day. It wasnâ€™t too crowded, which was nice. I ordered several dishes to try, and everything tasted just as good as the branch I had previously visited in Manhattan.

The Peking Duck is a must-tryâ€”absolutely delicious and something you shouldnâ€™t miss.

What made this location stand out, though, was the excellent service. Unlike the Manhattan branch, where the service can be a bit confusing and unorganized, the staff here were very attentive.

In particular, the managerâ€”Hudson (apologies if I spelled the name wrong)â€”was outstanding. He made sure everything ran smoothly and took great care of the customers.

Overall, the food was just as delicious as always, and the atmosphere at this branch is even better. There are more tables and space than the city location.

The only downside is the difficulty in finding parkingâ€”itâ€™s quite challenging. I recommend taking the subway if youâ€™re planning to visit. Itâ€™s very convenient, and the station is close by.

Also, this location is near Tangram Mall, so you can go for a nice walk or shopping after your meal.

Yummy food! Stopped by for a family dinner, super long wait though (could be from the extra crowd going to the blackpink concert), Peking duck wrap, cumin lamb on sizzling plate, stir fried string beans, sliced pork belly with garlic are good :)

Expect a long wait for the seats, make a reservation before coming to save some wait time or else it could be 45 min to an hour especially for larger groups, 4 people is a better size, but with more people you can try more dishes. They use mini table for the waitlist.

Price is also a bit higher so more for special occasions and celebrations.

You can usually tell if the food is pre-cooked just by how fast it comes out.

And about the tip â€” I gave a small one, and I could really feel the dissatisfaction from the waiter through his expression. But hey, when you served me a plate of cold spicy hot pot, you shouldâ€™ve known I wasnâ€™t going to give you a generous tip.
Ohï¼Œthe duck wasnâ€™t fresh too, tasteless! Horrible! Never going back there again!

7/22: We came here 7/22 for a restaurant week date night. The restaurant is decorated beautifully and quite larger than appears outside. We were seated in the booths and  were given tablets with restaurant week menu, drink and dinner menus to order.  While we did saw some of great dishes, we decided to order from the dinner menu. For drinks, I ordered the pink passion while my girlfriend ordered the mojito I really liked mine as it was on the sweeter side and was pretty refreshing. While she did like her drink, she preferred the pink passion. We decided to order pork soup dumplings. It came with 4 and were quite large. The soup was very flavorful and rich and the pork was great. We decided in ordering the pecking duck and the sliced marble beef in golden pepper broth.  We also ordered the seafood fried rice. I can eat this all day. This was delightful. The duck itself was fresh, tender and was balanced with a sweet and savory sauce accompanied with a gorgeous presentation of the food. We were also recommended to combine all of the ingredients and can say it was really refreshing and  tasty. A combination of sweet and fresh! The sliced marbled beef in golden pepper was exactly what the waiter had warned. Spicy as hell. However, it was still delicious. Overall a great experience and would definitely recommend!

Itâ€™s actually a pretty solid experience here every time. The staff is super super friendly and accommodating. I was probably ordering things left and right since we were a large party and they were so on top of everything. Itâ€™s also really good food and reasonable prices!

Delicious food and attentive service. For starters, the ordering system is incredibly convenient. You just use a tablet to order and then your waiter will come over to confirm everything.
Now onto the food. The soup dumplings were flavorful and bursting with rich, savory broth. I also recommend the cumin lamb on a sizzling plate, not only for the fiery table-side spectacle but for the equally impressive taste. The meatballs with salted duck yolk were also delicious, with each meatball having a generous amount of salted duck yolk. Definitely worth a visit!

First time coming, the staff is pleasant and the atmosphere is nice. The interior is spacious and comfortable. We ordered the boiled fish with pickled cabbage, sizzling cumin lamb, mapo tofu and the preserved ham fried vermicelli. All the dishes were flavorful and great. My family especially enjoyed the vermicelli. Looking forward to coming back soon.

visited this restaurant today and was very disappointed with the experience, especially considering the high price point.

We ordered the whole roasted duck for $100, expecting something freshly made and served hot. Instead, it was clearly pre-cooked and reheated. The duck wasnâ€™t even hot when it arrived, and within just five minutes, it was completely cold. The skin, which should have been crispy, was soft and soggy â€” a huge letdown.

What was even more unacceptable was the presence of multiple fruit flies flying around the table. This is supposed to be a premium dining experience where weâ€™re spending $70â€“$80 per person. Yet, we had to constantly wave our hands to keep insects from landing on our food. It was both unpleasant and unhygienic.

Aside from these issues, I will say that the other dishes we ordered tasted decent. But the quality of the duck and the fly problem completely ruined the experience for us. Definitely not worth the price.

Like one of my favourite restaurants of all time, and definitely top 3 in flushing. For fine dining Chinese, this is a MUST. Every dish is perfection. Must order the Peking duck, crab tofu, the water cress veggies (not sure English name), the okra is great. But you canâ€™t go wrong.

This is one of the BEST chinese restaurants that I have visited in a long time. I read some of the other reviews where people complain about the price to plate size ratio. But I disagree,  if you look at the items you can order,  they are specialty items like eel, liver, tongue ect. The restaurant need to buy a lot of these items to fill a plate. So I believe the price is right and the quality it 5 out of 5. I also think this is a Michelin Star restaurant. I highly recommend it ğŸ‘Œ

I recently visited Jiang Nan in Flushing and had such an amazing dining experience! The food was absolutely delicious, with authentic flavors that really stood out. Every dish was cooked perfectly, especially the [insert your favorite dish here â€“ e.g., spicy crab, Peking duck, or dry pot]. The ingredients tasted fresh, and the seasoning was spot on.

The restaurant itself is clean and nicely decorated, with a warm and inviting atmosphere. The staff were friendly, attentive, and quick with service, which made the whole meal even more enjoyable.

Overall, Jiang Nan is definitely one of the best Chinese restaurants in Flushing. Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for top-quality food and excellent service. Iâ€™ll definitely be coming back again soon!
The service is always great and pleasant. The food is perfectly cooked and delicious. Jiangnan is always my top choice to bring friends or do family dinner. Love it!

Jiang Nan in Flushing offers upscale Chinese dining with beautiful dÃ©cor and excellent service. The Peking duck is a must-tryâ€”crispy, juicy, and perfectly presented. The quality and atmosphere make it worth it. Great spot for group dinners or special occasions.

Jiang Nan in Flushing never disappoints! The menu is full of flavorful and authentic dishes, and everything we ordered was outstanding. The presentation was beautiful, portions were generous, and the taste was even better than expected.

What I really appreciate is how fast the service is despite how busy the restaurant can get. The staff are always polite and helpful with recommendations, making the whole dining experience smooth and enjoyable.

If youâ€™re in Flushing and want a true taste of high-quality Chinese cuisine, Jiang Nan is the place to go. Itâ€™s perfect for family gatherings, business dinners, or even just a casual night out. Canâ€™t wait to come back and try more dishes!

Had such a great meal here! The appetizers were awesome and got things off to a great start. The Peking Duck was super flavorful with crispy skin, and the fish hot pot (barramundi) was so goodâ€”full of rich, tangy broth.

One of my favorites was the sweet potato with salted egg yolkâ€”crispy, creamy, and just the right amount of savory. The ham fried rice was tasty and paired well with everything.

Service was really attentive, and overall, it was a great experience. Definitely coming back!

Tried Jiang Nan in Flushing for dinner last night and it was such a treat! The flavors were bold and authentic, and every dish had that perfect balance of spice and freshness. The highlight for me was the [insert favorite dish, e.g., cumin lamb or spicy noodles]â€”so tasty Iâ€™m still thinking about it today.

The atmosphere was lively but comfortable, and even though the place was packed, the service was quick and friendly. You can tell this is a spot locals love, and now I understand why. Definitely adding Jiang Nan to my list of go-to restaurants in Flushing!

I love the background music, the decorations and the environment here. It really represent the nameâ€ Jiang Nanâ€.

You can order Sichuan( spicy) Cantonese ( fresh and delicious) or Taiwanese cuisines. They all seem authentic. My favorite is the crab sauce over rice, it tastes rich, slightly briny, and deliciously moist.

This might be one of the best Chinese meals Iâ€™ve ever hadâ€”not just in New York, but possibly anywhere in the world. The four dishes we ordered exceeded expectations.

The ham fried rice was a perfect balance of flavorsâ€”possibly the best Iâ€™ve had since that unforgettable plate in Ipoh over a decade ago.

The stir-fried loofah, though seemingly pricey and plain with no soy sauce or heavy seasoning, turned out to be incredibly well-rounded in flavor. It redefines what Chinese cuisine can be, stripping away the usual bold sauces to reveal the yin and yang of taste.

The abalone soup was a masterpiece. The real star was the brothâ€”unbelievably rich and umami-filled. I honestly canâ€™t remember ever having soup like this. We polished off the entire pot without hesitation.

As for the Peking duckâ€¦ I wonâ€™t even try to describe it. Just go and try it for yourself.

There were only two of us, so we could order just four dishes. All we could do was sit there, regretting that our stomachs couldnâ€™t handle more.
Service is amazing and food is delicious. We ordered pineapple beer, Peking Duck, cumin Lamb and sautÃ©ed cauliflowers. Not only food is delicious, we received very attentive service by Waiter Dimi.

Delicious Chinese food! Everything tasted solid! I personally liked the peking duck, pickled spicy vegetables, and the fried rice. Looking forward to visiting again.
They were very friendly with the baby in our party and had a high chair!

One of my favorite peking duck experience with the crispy flavorful duck skin wrapped with the thinnest flour wrap. We got the private booth and had a great time as well.

Authentic Chinese dishes that are cooked to perfection. Great environment with good views (tho, def could crank up the AC a little more next time). The pineapple beer was good but has no kick. Otherwise, it was a good experience overall

Seating is smooth and no waiting.Nice decorated and designed environment.With some light Chinese music at background. Food was ordered through an iPad with photos and descriptions.  We ordered four dishes, SautÃ©ed Tofu with crab meat, taste was good and yummy. Flank steak W Katsu Sause, meat taste delicious with a special sauce. Stir fried Cauliflower with pork belly, this is a very mild spicy taste and is good for having with rice or noddles. The last we have Preserved Ham fried Vermicelli, which is a Chinese type rice noodles. We are pleased to have dinner in this Michelin rated restaurant. next time will come again and try their Peking duck.

ABSOLUTE GASSS, the duck bone soup was so refreshing and the portions were massive (this is off menu but just ask!). The eel was also delicious and super chunky, super savory. my favorite by far was the lotus and sticky riceâ€” a classic!â€¦

Tastes very good with good service
Definitely coming back whenever I'm back in New York (added this place to my favorites)
Japanese Tofu is amazing and the peking duck was really good

The dishes at Jiangnan are top-notchâ€”everything was super delicious, and the service was absolutely amazing. The only letdown was the fish, which was way too fishy for my tasteâ€”like, really fishy. But again, the service totally made up for it.

I went there with some friends and took the chance to introduce them to Chinese culture and the background behind each signature dish. Itâ€™s honestly a perfect spot to bring foreign friends if you want to share an authentic and flavorful experience.

The decor is also beautifully done, and the kimchi was a surprise hitâ€”super tasty. The Peking duck was just okay, a bit bland for my liking. But the braised intestines? A must-order. Super clean, full of flavor, and just melt-in-your-mouth good. The stir-fried noodles were also solid.

Overall, a definite five stars. Iâ€™ll 100% be coming back.

Love the waiting system, very convenient. The food was good in general. We had crispy fried fish, half Beijing roasted duck, fried rice and duck blood in chili sauce. The duck blood is a bit disappointing with the blood taste like plastic. The roasted duck was really tender inside and crispy on the skin - which we highly recommend it! The pork fired rice was also amazing, and the portion was good enough for at least four people.
We came in around 2pm, there were about 7 groups before us, but we waited for only 20 to 30mins for our table to be ready.
Will definitely come back again and try other dishes.

This place has the best Peking duck in Flushing for sure. They give a lot as well so we usually take some to finish later. They give a atmosphere is very good and the staff are incredibly polite and helpful. Highly recommend this place!

Very delicious and authentic Chinese cuisine! Our highlights were the Peking Duck and Cumin Lamb. The mouthwatering chicken and soup dumplings were solid, but nothing to write home about - recommend sticking with their signature dishes for the best experience.
Lovely vibe and delicious food! We had the eggplant which was really flavorful and the dumplings. Fast service on a Friday night!
